p: CHIKV titres in bodies were significantly higher in Ae. geniculatus vs Ae. albopictus (stratified Mann–Whitney-Wilcoxon rank sum test, p-value < 2.2e-16), with approximately one log 10 difference between values average across time points (5.1 vs 4.2 log 10 FFU/mL for Ae. geniculatus and Ae. albopictus, respectively). Virus titres in bodies were significantly different across time points post virus exposure in both species (Kruskal–Wallis rank sum test, p-value = 0.0002402 and 2.984e-15 for Ae. geniculatus and Ae. albopictus, respectively).
